title: Mass brawl on Ryanair flight forces pilot to make emergency landing. A family was asked to swap seat
content: ​A Ryanair flight last week had to be diverted when it was flying at 30,000 feet as a fight between two families became a mass brawl -- 30 minutes into the flight. Footage published by the Sun shows passengers screaming at each other on the Morocco to London flight. A witness to the shocking brawl said it all started with a passenger asking a woman to swap the seat so that he could sit with his wife and children.
summary: ​A Ryanair flight last week had to be diverted when it was flying at 30,000 feet as a fight between two families became a mass brawl -- 30 minutes into the flight. Footage published by the Sun shows passengers screaming at each other on the Morocco to London flight. A witness to the shocking brawl said it all started with a passenger asking a woman to swap the seat so that he could sit with his wife and children.

title: Did Hawk Tuah girl turn down Playboy offer? Here's the truth
content: Hailey Welch said it is true that Playboy approached her through a friend to include her in some of their stuff but she rejected it. The viral Hawk Tuah girl in an Instagram Q&A said she is not doing OnlyFans and will never do as she's not comfortable with that thing.
summary: Hailey Welch said it is true that Playboy approached her through a friend to include her in some of their stuff but she rejected it. The viral Hawk Tuah girl in an Instagram Q&A said she is not doing OnlyFans and will never do as she's not comfortable with that thing.

title: Why this Black radio host lost her job after interviewing Joe Biden
content: In an interview with CNN’s Victor Blackwell on Saturday, she admitted that these questions were part of eight suggested by Biden aides ahead of the interview. “The questions were sent to me for approval. I approved them,” she said. This has intensified the controversy surrounding Biden’s abilities following his lackluster performance in the first presidential debate, hosted by CNN.
summary: In an interview with CNN’s Victor Blackwell on Saturday, she admitted that these questions were part of eight suggested by Biden aides ahead of the interview. “The questions were sent to me for approval. I approved them,” she said. This has intensified the controversy surrounding Biden’s abilities following his lackluster performance in the first presidential debate, hosted by CNN.

title: Civilians' military trial: SC directs AG of Pakistan to address families' concerns over meetings with prisoners
Over 1,300 flights cancelled across US as Hurricane Beryl intensifies
content: Hurricane Beryl wreaks havoc in the US, causing over 1300 flight cancellations and delays. United and Southwest airlines issue travel advisories as the storm intensifies. With 11 deaths in the Caribbean, Beryl becomes a Category 1 hurricane. Brace for impact as it threatens to escalate to Category 2 upon landfall.
summary: Hurricane Beryl wreaks havoc in the US, causing over 1300 flight cancellations and delays. United and Southwest airlines issue travel advisories as the storm intensifies. With 11 deaths in the Caribbean, Beryl becomes a Category 1 hurricane. Brace for impact as it threatens to escalate to Category 2 upon landfall.

title: Stranded aid trucks in Egypt deepen Gaza's humanitarian crisis
Russian official says US left arms treaty to build weapons to menace China
Texas hunkers down as Hurricane Beryl hits coast
US President Biden gets instruction ahead of events? Staffers guide him on 'how to enter and exit' venue
content: President Joe Biden receives detailed instruction cards with large print and venue photos, outlining his path to the podium, according to Axios. This has sparked debates about his fitness for office amid calls for him to withdraw from the race. Some Democrats and staffers have questioned whether these preparations conceal the president's limitations. Republicans have criticized Biden's stage movements to suggest mental unfit. Supporters argue such planning is standard for security and event complexities.
summary: President Joe Biden receives detailed instruction cards with large print and venue photos, outlining his path to the podium, according to Axios. This has sparked debates about his fitness for office amid calls for him to withdraw from the race. Some Democrats and staffers have questioned whether these preparations conceal the president's limitations. Republicans have criticized Biden's stage movements to suggest mental unfit. Supporters argue such planning is standard for security and event complexities.

title: Russian missiles hit a children's hospital in the Ukrainian capital and kill at least 10 elsewhere
France in limbo after Macron gamble fails to break political deadlock
$1,000 for new parents? 'Baby bonus' initiative will pass if Baltimore voters approve
content: Baltimore residents may receive $1,000 under the "baby bonus" program, aimed at supporting new parents to combat childhood poverty from birth. Following a successful signature drive, the initiative will appear on November's ballot. Inspired by a Flint, Michigan model, it mirrors efforts in Europe and Asia to boost birth rates. Organizers argue for this initial step amid broader poverty solutions.
summary: Baltimore residents may receive $1,000 under the "baby bonus" program, aimed at supporting new parents to combat childhood poverty from birth. Following a successful signature drive, the initiative will appear on November's ballot. Inspired by a Flint, Michigan model, it mirrors efforts in Europe and Asia to boost birth rates. Organizers argue for this initial step amid broader poverty solutions.

title: He once planned to use them to kill himself; Napoleon Bonaparte's pistols auctioned for 1.69 million euros
content: The guns, adorned with gold and silver inlays, feature a carved image of Napoleon in full imperial pomp. According to auction house expert Jean-Pierre Osenat, these weapons were nearly used by Napoleon to end his life in 1814 after his army's defeat and the occupation of Paris by foreign forces. ​​​​The French government has classified them as national treasures, placing a ban on their export. The buyer's identity remains undisclosed.
summary: The guns, adorned with gold and silver inlays, feature a carved image of Napoleon in full imperial pomp. According to auction house expert Jean-Pierre Osenat, these weapons were nearly used by Napoleon to end his life in 1814 after his army's defeat and the occupation of Paris by foreign forces. ​​​​The French government has classified them as national treasures, placing a ban on their export. The buyer's identity remains undisclosed.

title: Boeing agrees to plea guilty in fraud conspiracy, evades criminal trial over 737 MAX crashes
'Forces will carry out its mission': Kim Jong Un's sister threatens action over South Korea's live-fire drills
content: Kim Yo Jang, sister of North Korea's Kim Jong Un, threatens military action in response to South Korea's live-fire drills. Tensions rise as South Korea suspends 2018 military pact. Skepticism surrounds North Korea's recent missile tests. Border tensions escalate over provocations.
summary: Kim Yo Jang, sister of North Korea's Kim Jong Un, threatens military action in response to South Korea's live-fire drills. Tensions rise as South Korea suspends 2018 military pact. Skepticism surrounds North Korea's recent missile tests. Border tensions escalate over provocations.

title: Hungary's Orban makes surprise visit to China after trips to Russia and Ukraine
'Gaza ceasefire deal must allow Israel to resume fighting until its objectives are met': Benjamin Netanyahu
content: The three-phase plan, presented by US President Joe Biden in May and mediated by Qatar and Egypt, seeks to end the war and secure the release of approximately 120 Israeli hostages held in Gaza.
summary: The three-phase plan, presented by US President Joe Biden in May and mediated by Qatar and Egypt, seeks to end the war and secure the release of approximately 120 Israeli hostages held in Gaza.

title: Philippines and Japan sign defence pact, with eyes on China
content: The Philippines and Japan have signed a reciprocal access agreement to deploy forces on each other's soil, enhancing military cooperation. The deal aims to address rising tensions in the Indo-Pacific region, particularly concerning China's maritime claims. Both countries are strengthening defense ties to bolster deterrence capabilities.
summary: The Philippines and Japan have signed a reciprocal access agreement to deploy forces on each other's soil, enhancing military cooperation. The deal aims to address rising tensions in the Indo-Pacific region, particularly concerning China's maritime claims. Both countries are strengthening defense ties to bolster deterrence capabilities.

title: Watch: Pastor asks congregation to stand during church service, Biden 'sits in trance'
content: President Joe Biden recently faced an embarrassing situation when a video circulated online, showing him sitting motionless and seemingly unaware as a pastor called for the congregation to rise during a campaign visit to a church in Philadelphia. This latest misstep has fueled ongoing worries about his suitability as a candidate in the upcoming 2024 presidential election.
summary: President Joe Biden recently faced an embarrassing situation when a video circulated online, showing him sitting motionless and seemingly unaware as a pastor called for the congregation to rise during a campaign visit to a church in Philadelphia. This latest misstep has fueled ongoing worries about his suitability as a candidate in the upcoming 2024 presidential election.

title: Landslides kill 12 on Indonesia's Sulawesi island, 18 missing
content: At least 12 died, 18 are missing after torrential rain caused a landslide in an illegal gold mine in Sumawa district, Sulawesi. Five survivors evacuated. 164 national rescue team, police, military personnel, led by Heriyanto, are searching. Thick mud, continuing rain hinder efforts. Houses, bridge damaged. Rain expected in Gorontalo, BNPB warns.
summary: At least 12 died, 18 are missing after torrential rain caused a landslide in an illegal gold mine in Sumawa district, Sulawesi. Five survivors evacuated. 164 national rescue team, police, military personnel, led by Heriyanto, are searching. Thick mud, continuing rain hinder efforts. Houses, bridge damaged. Rain expected in Gorontalo, BNPB warns.
